ðŸ”¥ gittype | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Improving typing skills and code familiarity through gamified typing challenges using your own source code.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multi-language support â€¢ Real-time metrics (WPM, accuracy, consistency) â€¢ Ranking system with developer titles â€¢ Multiple game modes (Normal, Time Attack, custom difficulty) â€¢ Pause/resume functionality
ðŸ“– Summary: GitType is a CLI tool that turns your source code into typing challenges, allowing you to improve your typing skills while familiarizing yourself with your codebase. It supports multiple languages and offers real-time metrics, a ranking system, and various game modes to make code-typing practice engaging and productive.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ flint | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing KVM virtual machines with a focus on simplicity and efficiency.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Modern Web UI (Next.js + Tailwind) â€¢ Single Binary (<11MB) â€¢ Powerful CLI & API â€¢ Cloud-Init Support â€¢ Snapshot-Based Templates
ðŸ“– Summary: Flint is a lightweight KVM management tool designed for developers, sysadmins, and home labs. It provides a modern web UI, CLI, and API for managing virtual machines, emphasizing ease of use and minimal bloat. It supports features like cloud-init, snapshot-based templates, and secure authentication.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ leantime | PHP
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Project management for teams, especially those without dedicated project managers, focusing on ease of use and comprehensive feature set.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Task management (Kanban, Gantt, table, list, calendar views) â€¢ Subtasks and dependencies â€¢ Milestone management â€¢ Sprint Management â€¢ Time tracking and timesheets
ðŸ“– Summary: Leantime is an open-source project management system designed for non-project managers, emphasizing ease of use and accessibility. It combines strategy, planning, and execution features, offering alternatives to tools like Trello, Jira, ClickUp, Monday, and Asana. It includes features for task management, project planning, knowledge management, and administration.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ mobile-use | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating tasks on Android and iOS devices using natural language commands.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Natural Language Control â€¢ UI-Aware Automation â€¢ Data Scraping â€¢ Extensible & Customizable
ðŸ“– Summary: Mobile-use is an open-source AI agent that enables natural language control of Android and iOS devices. It allows users to automate tasks, navigate apps, and extract data using natural language commands, effectively bridging the gap between human intention and mobile device interaction.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ streamdown | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Rendering streaming Markdown content, especially from AI models, in React applications.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Drop-in replacement for `react-markdown` â€¢ Streaming-optimized â€¢ Unterminated block parsing â€¢ GitHub Flavored Markdown support â€¢ Math rendering (KaTeX)
ðŸ“– Summary: Streamdown is a TypeScript library that serves as a drop-in replacement for react-markdown, specifically designed for handling streaming Markdown content, particularly from AI models. It excels at gracefully formatting incomplete or unterminated Markdown blocks, making it suitable for real-time content generation and display.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ ccpm | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing Claude Code projects with parallel AI agent execution and full traceability using GitHub Issues and Git worktrees.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Spec-driven development â€¢ GitHub Issues integration for task management â€¢ Git worktrees for parallel execution â€¢ Parallel AI agent execution â€¢ Persistent context across sessions
ðŸ“– Summary: The ccpm repository provides a project management system tailored for Claude Code, leveraging GitHub Issues and Git worktrees to enable parallel agent execution. It aims to improve team collaboration, maintain context, and ensure traceability throughout the development process, from PRD creation to production code.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ vdu_controls | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Controlling external monitor settings (brightness, contrast, audio) and automating brightness adjustments based on ambient light conditions.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Brightness and contrast control â€¢ Audio control â€¢ Ambient light-based automatic brightness control (hardware light meter integration)
ðŸ“– Summary: vdu_controls is a Python-based control panel for external monitors (VDUs) connected via DisplayPort, DVI, HDMI, or USB. It allows users to adjust brightness, contrast, and audio, and supports ambient light-based automatic brightness control using hardware light meters or solar-illumination estimation. The application can run in the system tray and adapts to light and dark Qt desktop themes.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
